intro: Sticherus longipinnatus, commonly known as the long-pinnate sticherus, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that are arranged in a pinnate pattern. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Sticherus longipinnatus is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions.
